= wireshark =

== filters ==
<pre>
#
http.request.uri matches "q=wireshark"

ip.addr == 192.0.2.1
ip.src == 192.0.2.1
dns or http
tcp.port == 443

# flag TCP problems in the trace (packet loss, etc)
tcp.analysis.flags

# remove noise
!(arp or dns or icmp)

tcp contains facebook

http.request

http.response.code == 200

# look for syn attack
tcp.flags.syn == 1
# look for tcp reset
tcp.flags.reset == 1

</pre>
